page.title: 04TRANSPORT 06200219
page.content: THERE ARE ABOUT 52 TRAINS THAT GO THROUGH FRINTON.99% OF THEM STOP AT THE STATION. FIRST TRAIN TO LONDON IS AT 06:12 AND THE LAST IS AT 19:31. ORDINARY RETURN COSTS Â£16:00 AND A DAY RETURN, AVAILABLE AFTER 08:40, COSTS Â£8:50. THE STATION WAS OPENED IN 1886 TO CONNECT FRINTON WITH COLCHESTER AND LONDON. QUEEN MARY VISITED THE STATION IN 1920. THERE WERE TWO RAILWAY LINES BUT ONE WAS REMOVED IN 1975 AS AN ECONOMY MEASURE.THE SIGNAL BOX WAS ENLARGED AT THIS TIME. THE STATION IS USED BY HOLIDAY MAKERS,LOCAL PEOPLE AND COMMUTERS.THE LATTER FREQUENTLY COMPLAIN IN THE LOCAL PRESS ABOUT THE QUALITY OF THE BRITISH RAIL SERVICE, THE CONNECTING TRAINS,THE DIRTY TRAINS AND THE MANY DELAYS.
